summary: One World Trade Center, or Freedom Tower, is the tallest building in the U.S. and the Western Hemisphere. It's in New York City, where the old World Trade Center was before 9/11. Construction started in 2006, and it opened in 2014. The building is 1,776 feet tall, a number that honors the year the U.S. Declaration of Independence was signed. It's part of a new complex with offices, a museum, and a transportation hub, all to remember and rebuild after the 2001 attacks.
title: One World Trade Center
